description: This table contains basic information about patient infections.

columns.name: INFECTION_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the infection record.

columns.name: RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The record status category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Soft Deleted


Hidden


Hidden and Soft Deleted

columns.name: INFECTION_RECORD_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The record type category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Encounter Level


Patient Level

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: INFECTION_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The infection type category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: INF_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The infection status category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Resolved


Infection Expired


Deleted


Rule-Out Test Resulted


Encounter Ended


Rule-Out Test Canceled


Patient Deceased

columns.name: HOW_ADDED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The how added category ID for the infection. This indicates the method by which the infection was added to the patient chart.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


User


Import


Auto-Update (Result)


Rule-Out (Order Placed)


Interface


Conversion


BPA Follow-Up (Manual)


BPA Follow-Up (Automatic)


Bulk Action - Add Infection


Bulk Action - Contact Trace Add Infection

columns.name: ADD_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC date and time that the infection was added to the patient chart.

columns.name: ADD_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the user who added the infection. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.

columns.name: RESOLVE_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC date and time that the infection was resolved in the patient chart.

columns.name: RESOLVE_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the user who resolved the infection. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: The date when the infection is set to automatically expire.

columns.name: DOESNT_EXPIRE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the infection should not automatically expire. 'Y' indicates that the infection requires clinical judgement to be marked as resolved. 'N' or NULL indicates that it is safe for the infection to expire automatically if an expiration date is given.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: REVIEW_DATE
columns.description: The date that the infection should be reviewed.

columns.name: ONSET_DATE
columns.description: The date that the infection began.

columns.name: COMMENTS
columns.description: User-entered comments associated with the infection.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The specimen type category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: SPECIMEN_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The specimen source category ID for the infection.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RECORD_CREATION_DATE
columns.description: The date the infection record was created.

columns.name: ADD_LOCAL_DTTM
columns.description: The local date and time that the infection was added to the patient chart.

columns.name: RESOLVE_LOCAL_DTTM
columns.description: The local date and time that the infection was resolved in the patient chart.

columns.name: ISOLATION_LINKS_CALCULATED_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether all linked isolations have been calculated. 'Y' indicates all linked isolations have been calculated. 'N' or NULL indicates that there may be isolations that would be considered linked to the infection, but that pre-date the linking calculation.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DOESNT_EXPIRE_YN
